label: U.S. Citizenship and SSBI required for personnel
quote: Eligible personnel must be a U.S. Citizen and must already have or be able to obtain a complete and active Single-Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) with CBP.

label: No work until favorable suitability determination
quote: Contractor employees will not begin working under this task order until a favorable suitability determination is made by CBP’s Personnel Security Division within the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR).

label: Identification badge required for facility visits
quote: Contractor employees visiting Government facilities will wear an identification badge that, at a minimum, displays the Contractor name, the employee’s photo, the contractor employees name, clearance-level and badge expiration date.

label: Compliance with Government escort rules
quote: Visiting Contractor employees will comply with all Government escort rules and requirements.

label: Contractor status and badge display requirements
quote: All Contractor employees will identify themselves as Contractors when their status is not readily apparent and always display all identification and visitor badges in plain view above the waist.

label: Government issued badge display above waist on-site
quote: Contractor employees working on-site at Government facilities will wear a Government issued identification badge... and display the Government issued badge in plain view above the waist at all times.

label: Contractor identification in meetings and communications
quote: All Contractor employees will identify themselves as Contractors when their status is not readily apparent (in meetings, when answering Government telephones, in e-mail messages, etc.)

label: Compliance with Government regulations at facilities
quote: Contractor’s employees will comply with all applicable Government regulations, policies and procedures (e.g., fire, safety, sanitation, environmental protection, security, 'off limits' areas, wearing of parts of DHS uniforms, and possession of weapons) when visiting or working at Government facilities.

label: Professional appearance and conduct required
quote: The Contractor will ensure Contractor employees present a professional appearance at all times and that their conduct will not reflect discredit on the United States or the Department of Homeland Security.

label: Employees must understand and follow DHS safety/security rules
quote: The contractor will ensure its employees understand and abide by Department of Homeland Security established rules, regulations and policies concerning safety and security.

label: Internal Quality Control Plan (QCP) required
quote: The contractor’s internal QCP must document how the contractor will meet and comply with the standards specified in this SOW and in accordance with U. S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM), Civil Service Retirement System (CSRS) and Federal Employee Retirement System (FERS) Handbook.

label: QCP must include procedures for quality, timeliness, responsiveness
quote: At a minimum, the QCP must include an outline of the procedures that the contractor will use to maintain quality, timeliness, responsiveness, and other requirements set forth in this solicitation.

label: Responsible for quality and timely completion of services
quote: The contractor will be responsible for the quality and timely completion of all contractor services.

label: Process cases within specified timeframes
quote: The contractor employee should process retirement, benefits and other relevant cases within the specified timeframe designated by the CBP Program Office... For retirement case processing, this would be within 30 calendar days prior to the effective date or 30 calendar days of receipt of a late retirement package. For benefits processing, this would be within 10 calendar days of the receipt of the benefits form. For all other duties outside of the direct scope of a retirement package or a benefits form, the expectation would be a 10-calendar day turnaround unless explicit instruction otherwise is given by assigning RABAS leadership.

label: Meet 85% standard for timely completion of assignments
quote: There will be an 85% standard requirement for timely completion of assignments.

label: Corrective action for more than three late assignments
quote: If there are more than three (3) unapproved or uninstructed late assignments, the contractor will take corrective action.

label: Remove employee if performance not satisfied after corrective action
quote: If the performance has not been satisfied within 90-days, the contractor employee will be removed from the contract.

label: Maintain 85% or higher accuracy rating
quote: The contractor employee will maintain an 85% or higher accuracy rating as will be determined by a quarter case quality review performed by RABAS leadership.

label: Meet 85% standard for accurate completion of assignments
quote: There will be an 85% standard requirement for accurate completion of assignments.

label: Corrective action if accuracy drops below 85%
quote: If in any quarterly case a quality review of the contractor employee’s percentage of accuracy drops below 85%, the contractor will take

label: Continue services if employee removed from DHS facilities
quote: Removal does not relieve the Contractor of the responsibility to continue providing the services required under the contract.

label: Limit customer service complaints and take corrective action if exceeded
quote: The contractor will receive no more than three (3) justified written customer service complaints from customers or Program Office Management within one calendar year... If more than three (3) written complaints are received, the contractor will take corrective action. If the performance has not been satisfied within 90-days, the contractor employee will be removed from the contract.

label: Monthly QCP report submission to COR
quote: The contractor will prepare and submit an electronic copy of the QCP Report to the COR by the 10th of each month for the previous month’s services.

label: Submit draft QCP within 5 days of award
quote: The contractor will submit a draft copy of the QCP no later than 5 calendar days after contract award date.

label: Submit finalized QCP within 15 days of award
quote: The contractor’s finalized QCP will be submitted to the COR no later than 15 calendar days after contract award date.
